chunks.cleaned_english_translation:
Diploma Four

King Sigebert grants a tenth of all his revenue in the region of Speyer to the church of Speyer, around the year 653.
chunks.original_latin:
DIPLOMA IV,
Quo Sigebertus rex, omnium proventuum suorum in
pago Spirensi decimam partem ecclesiae Spirensi
adscribit  (circa ann. 653).

chunks.cleaned_english_translation:
King Sigebert grants a tenth of all his revenue in the region of Speyer to the church of Speyer, around the year 653.

Sigibert, King of the Franks, is a distinguished man. Whatever the royal authority decides in the name of God for the benefit of churches, for supporting the clergy, or for aiding the poor, and whatever is carried out or confirmed according to God's commands, can help in this life and, with the saints' and the Lord's guidance, prepare us for the eternal journey.

Therefore, we trust that God's will should prevail, and that the entire people should annually contribute from all the land's fruits to the holy Catholic Church, as our royal ancestors decreed. With Christ's favor, our decision is that from all the land's produce within the Speyer region, whether grain, wine, honey, livestock, or pigs, and any other payments related to us, the people should also tithe pigs fattened in the forests or any livestock related to our treasury in Speyer, annually to the church of Nemetum, where Lord Principius, the bishop, presides.

The tenth part should be offered and fulfilled, so that when this tenth is presented annually for the clergy's support or the poor's sustenance, we believe the Creator will reward us sevenfold here and in the future.

Therefore, ensure that what our devotion holds and God's will remains constant, you strive to fulfill, so that by Christ's grace and the saints' guidance, as we trust, it benefits us, and, God forbid, does not become an offense to God or to us.
chunks.original_latin:
Sigibertus, rex Francorum, vir inluster . Quietquit
in Dei nomine serenitas regia, pro ecclesiarum
compendia vel in stipendia clerum aut alimonia
 pauperum perpensatur, vel hoc, quod juxta Dei
mandata adimpletur aut confirmatur, illud et in praesenti
seculi luce potest praestare auxilium, et credimus
quod, in eterni itineris, per intervencionem
domnorum sanctorum, sive duce Domino, preparet
 in futurum. Igitur dum et confidimus quod Dei debeat
manere voluntas et ut taliter cunctus populus
de omnibus fructibus terre, ad sancta Ecclesia catholica
per unumquemque annum debentur inferre,
adeo ita quod juxta ad anteriorum regum quondam
parentum nostrorum decrevit devocio, ita, Christo
propicio, manet nostra deliberacio, ut de omnes
fructus terre infra pago Spirense, quantumcunque
fiscus noster continet, tam de annona quam de vino,
mel, sive jumenta, de porcos, quam et de omni reliqua
solucione ad nos aspiciencia, sic et homines fisci
faciant decimas porcorum, qui in forestis insaginatur,
aut omne genus pecodum, quantum in ipso pago
Spirense ad fiscos nostros pertinetur, annis singulis
ad ecclesiam Nemetense, ubi apostolicus vir,
 pater noster, domnus Principius , episcopus preesse
 videtur, decimus caput debeatur offerre et adimplere,
quatinus dum ipse decimus annis singulis
idem in stipendia clerum vel alimonia pauperum
presentemur. Credimus ut Creator omnium nostrorum,
nostris usibus, hic et in futuro septempliciter
hoc jubeat remunerare. Agite ergo, qualiter hoc,
quod semper nostra continet devocio, vel Dei manet
voluntas semper in omnibus procuretis adimplere,
qualiter nobis Christi gratia vel domnorum sanctorum,
ut confidimus, debeat pertinere, et ut vobis ,
quod absit, ad offensa Dei, aut nostra non debeat
pervenire.

chunks.cleaned_english_translation: To ensure our current authority is maintained in a continuous order by you, our juniors, and successors, and remains valid in all respects, we have decided to reinforce it with our signatures below.
chunks.original_latin:
Et ut cercius vobis juniores successoresque
nostros presens auctoritas inconvulso ordine observetur,
vel in omnibus debeatur permanere, manus
nostre subscriptionibus subter eam decrevimus roborari.
